ref: 8129 pāláyati ʻ guards, protects ʼ AV. [An l -- form of pārá- yati1, as pālá -- of pārá -- 1, replacing and in pop. etym. associated with √pā2 ʻ protect ʼ EWA ii 262 with lit. <-> √pr̥ or &rcirclemacr Pa. pālēti ʻ guards ʼ, Pk. pālēi; Sh. palóĭki̯ (3 sg. &egrevebrev ʻ to hand something to someone ʼ; K. pālun ʻ to protect, nourish ʼ, ḍoḍ. palurō ʻ kept (of animals) ʼ; S. pāraṇu ʻ to support, supply with food ʼ (pālaṇu ʻ to maintain, rear ʼ ← Centre); L. pāḷaṇ, (Ju.) pālaṇ ʻ to nourish, feed up ʼ, awāṇ. pāluṇ, P. pālaṇā, Ku. pālaṇo; N. pālnu ʻ to keep, tame, (hon.) go ʼ; A. pāliba ʻ to nourish, tend ʼ; B. pālā ʻ to rear, keep ʼ, Or. pāḷibā, H. pālnā, OMarw. pālaï, G. pāḷvũ, M. pāḷṇẽ. -- Intransitives with -- a -- replacing -- ā -- : L.awāṇ. paluṇ ʻ to be nourished ʼ (whence again tr. in mult. pallaṇ ʻ to nourish ʼ); P. palṇā ʻ to be nourished, grow ʼ; N. palāunu ʻ to thrive ʼ; H. palnā ʻ to be reared, be fattened, become tender ʼ; G. paḷvũ ʻ to be nurtured ʼ.
WPah.kṭg. paḷnõ ʻ to rear, breed, foster ʼ.
